channel.description: Better nannying for North Carolina starts here!

image.title: Socializing – North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies

item.title: Holiday Secret Gift Exchange 2022
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: Looking to add a little nanny cheer to your upcoming winter celebrations? Nanny Beth has created a Nannies Only gift exchange (sometimes known as a secret Santa exchange) for us! Details in the post.
item.content:encoded:
Looking to add a little nanny cheer to your upcoming winter celebrations? Nanny Beth has created a Nannies Only gift exchange (sometimes known as a secret Santa exchange) for us!

Click on this Facebook group, fill out the getting to know you post, and wait to see who your match is. Then make sure you pick out the perfect gift and send it by the deadline.

Gift price target is $30. Sign up by 21 November 2022. Ship gifts on 10 December 2022.

item.title: iNNRW: Why I love being/having a nanny!
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: National Nanny Recognition Week isn't just for families to honor nannies, nor for nannies to honor each other, but is also for nannies to honor themselves. // Employers, let your nanny know why s/he is appreciated. Post your thoughts on this topic to your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, personal blog, or as a comment on our iNNRW daily post, and then share those thoughts with your nanny!
item.content:encoded:
Why I Love Being a Nanny

National Nanny Recognition Week isn’t just for families to honor nannies, nor for nannies to honor each other, but is also for nannies to honor themselves. Come to our Facebook page and find the post-promt to tell the world why you love being a nanny!

Why I Love Having a Nanny

Employers, let your nanny know why s/he is appreciated. Post your thoughts on this topic to your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, personal blog, or as a comment on our iNNRW daily post, and then share those thoughts with your nanny!

If you do not have social media accounts, you can submit by emailing to communications@ncpan.org and our team will post on your behalf at the end of the day.

Thank you all for starting the celebration off right!

Check out previous years’ posts!

item.title: 2022 National Nanny Get-Together
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Levenbook
item.description: This year, the National Nanny Night Out has gone bigger into a whole weekend of Nanny Get-Togethers!
item.content:encoded:
This year, the National Nanny Night Out has gone bigger into a whole weekend of Nanny Get-Togethers, and as always we here at NC PAN want to make sure you know where to find your local one. Some NC localities are organizing hyper-local meetings that aren’t being announced on the big Nanny Care Hub list page, and some NC localities are choosing a date that is more locally responsive.

Presented in alphabetical order, your options are:

Chapel Hill

Sunday, 26 June 2022 | Starts at Dark

Grab your favorite beverage, some snacks, your bug spray, and your lawn chair or picnic blanket and come on over to the host’s back yard for a movie under the stars! We will have door prizes including the opportunity to win a year’s Supporting Membership perks. This event is additionally sponsored by the North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies.

RSVP to Attend

COVID Policy
Do not attend this event if you are within a week of a positive COVID test result, if you are feeling ill even if not positive for COVID, or if you have an objection to wearing masks. As this event is outdoors, we do not require masking. Masks will be required to enter the house for the purposes of using the bathroom.

Durham

Saturday, 2nd July 2022 | 4 pm to 10 pm

Join us in welcoming an out-of-town nanny who is considering relocating to the area by all meeting at the Old Mill Farm’s Summer Sizzle Concert for the 2nd of July. Cost of admission is $25/car and while you can bring your own food and snacks, alcohol is not allowed. Carpooling encouraged because of the car fee. Coordination for carpools is being done by Nanny Posse placement agency (who will place you for babysitting side work too!). Contact for carpool.

Read Nanny Posse’s Instagram stories in order to find our meeting location.

Did we miss a Get-Together that you know about? Message our webmaster and let them know or simply offer it up in the comments (faster way to get it publicized). If you build it, we can help people know about it so that they can come.

Don’t see a Get-Together for your area? Host one yourself! Not only will Nanny Care Hub let you submit it to their database, not only will we publicize it here, but we also have a host package for you consisting of some door prizes and a gift just for you for being the host. Contact our Social Chair for details.

item.title: Nanny Night Out Dinner (NNRW 2021)
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Levenbook
item.description: Come and celebrate the end of National Nanny Recognition Week with food, fun, and nannies from your area! Make new friends! Renew old friendships! Experience the support and camaraderie that only a Nanny Night Out can bring. This event is open to everyone, regardless of membership in the North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies. Non-members might enjoy joining the Friends of NC PAN […]
item.content:encoded:
Come and celebrate the end of National Nanny Recognition Week with food, fun, and nannies from your area! Make new friends! Renew old friendships! Experience the support and camaraderie that only a Nanny Night Out can bring.

This event is open to everyone, regardless of membership in the North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies. Non-members might enjoy joining the Friends of NC PAN listserv to learn about further opportunities like this one.

This event is offered as part of the North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies‘s National Nanny Recognition Week celebration. Click [here] to learn more about National Nanny Recognition Week.

Triangle Region

Rice Ball Themed Potluck
Thursday, September 23rd @ 5:30 pm
Umstead Park
399 Umstead Dr
Chapel Hill, NC 27516

RSVP via Facebook. (You may have to join the Regional Playdates Facebook Group first.) If you don’t have Facebook, please contact webmaster@ncpan.org.

​In a different region?

Volunteer as host for your region’s capstone dinner on any day of National Nanny Recognition Week! If you build it, they will come! Contact the NC PAN webmaster via webmaster@ncpan.org to get started. We will promote your event, add it to this post, help you gather RSVPs, and help you connect with nannies in your area.

All social events are volunteer hosted by member nannies!

item.title: The Recognition Playdates (NNRW 2021)
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Levenbook
item.description: National Nanny Recognition Week is to shine a glorious spotlight on to the fact that we nannies exist and rock at our jobs. What better way than to do that fabulous job, en masse, in public. And so we will! Join a flash mob of nannies and their charges having an outing to a public […]
item.content:encoded:
National Nanny Recognition Week is to shine a glorious spotlight on to the fact that we nannies exist and rock at our jobs. What better way than to do that fabulous job, en masse, in public. And so we will! Join a flash mob of nannies and their charges having an outing to a public play area where moms and dads and grandmas and grandpas and aunts and uncles and completely disinterested strangers can all bask in the awe of the awesomeness of the way that nannies handle such things.

Read below for details on how your region is planning to awesome-bomb in order to gain recognition.

Triangle East (indoor)

Date and Time: Tuesday, September 21th at 9:30 to 11 am

Location: Little Doodles Play Cafe

Let’s celebrate National Nanny Recognition Week with a play date at Little Doodles Play Cafe on Glenwood Avenue in Raleigh organized by Nanny Tiffany Williams on Tuesday, September 21st from 9:30-11am!

Cost is $5 per child, adults and babies under 12 months are free! There is a messy art studio and discovery room that you can add on for an additional $5. You can buy pieces of art to paint for an additional cost if you want.

No outside food is allowed! They have a cafe and snack bar to buy snacks, treats and drinks.

No shoes or bare feet allowed. Everyone must wear socks. Socks are available for $2 if you forget to bring them!

Come any time and stay as long as you want!

Chick Fil A at Townridge is across the parking lot for anyone who wants to grab lunch after.

We’ve parked behind Chick Fil A and brought picnic blankets to eat on if you want to do that too!

Register and RSVP on Facebook (you may need to join the Triangle Nanny Tribe Group first), or by messaging volunteer host Tiffany.

Triangle West (outside)

Date and Time: Tuesday, September 21th at 10:30 am to 12 noon

Location: Durham Central Park’s Mt. Merrill Playground

Join local area nannies for a meet up at Durham Central Park’s popular Troll Story Time. The children will get a few books on a theme followed by a thematic craft or activity. After that, it is free play on the Mount Merrill Playground where the nannies can schmooze while the children slide and climb. Children can picnic for lunch, too.

Meet at “The Leaf”, an open air pavilion right next to the playground. https://goo.gl/maps/9wfegqAe2ZhKkXBFA

Rain location is “The Pavilion”. Masks are required for everyone.

Here is what Durham Parks and Rec says about Troll Story Time. https://durhamcentralpark.org/events/storytime/

Free parking on the side streets that flank the park. Look for Jen in the bright pink NANNY shirt.

Register and RSVP on Facebook (you may need to join the Playdates Group first), or by messaging volunteer host Jen.

Don’t see your region listed? Pick a place to play, such as a park or other play zone, and email the webmaster and we’ll send people your way. It is as simple as that.

item.title: Winterfest + All Members Meeting 2020
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: It is once again time for NC PAN members to make their voices heard during our annual All Members meeting. This year, we are being generously hosted in the Zoom of one of our Agency Affiliates. You must be RSVPed as “going” to receive the joining information. If you don’t have a Facebook account, send […]
item.content:encoded:
It is once again time for NC PAN members to make their voices heard during our annual All Members meeting. This year, we are being generously hosted in the Zoom of one of our Agency Affiliates. You must be RSVPed as “going” to receive the joining information. If you don’t have a Facebook account, send an email to winterfest2020@ncpan.org with your yes-RSVP and we’ll send you the information via email.

Our holiday gathering for nannies and those they love, this year, will be on December 19th from 5:30 to 9 pm.

All Members Meeting, limited to supporting members, will begin at 5:30 pm, promptly, as we have a lot to cover. Reports will be given by all of the board members, and your feedback will be solicited. How do you want NC PAN to serve you in 2021?

Following that meeting, from 5:45 pm to 6 pm is the awarding of the earned memberships to those who went above and beyond in this pandemic. If you have someone to nominate, you have until the 17th of December to nominate them for inclusion in this award ceremony. Read about that award, here. Anyone is invited to attend and cheer for these Superstar Nannies.

And finally from 6-9 pm will be a party for EVERYONE: nanny, nanny-adjacent, or just a nanny-supporter!

Here is a brief outline of the schedule:
6 – 7 pm: Agency Affiliate party hour; there will be prizes!
7 – 9 pm: Nanny movie with a drinking game (water, naturally) to make sure we all stay hydrated.
9 pm: Goodbyes.

So join us to retire 2020 in grand, nanny-budget-friendly fashion while we welcome 2021 with eager anticipation of it fulfilling your needs!

RSVP HERE for WinterFest.

item.title: Holiday Secret Gift Exchange
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: Looking to add a little nanny cheer to your upcoming winter celebrations? Nanny Autumn of Raleigh, NC, has started a North Carolina Nannies Only gift exchange (sometimes known as a secret santa exchange) for us! Click on this Elfster link, make a profile so your gift giver knows how to personalize the gift, and wait […]
item.content:encoded:
Looking to add a little nanny cheer to your upcoming winter celebrations? Nanny Autumn of Raleigh, NC, has started a North Carolina Nannies Only gift exchange (sometimes known as a secret santa exchange) for us!

Click on this Elfster link, make a profile so your gift giver knows how to personalize the gift, and wait to see who your match is. Then make sure you pick out the perfect gift and send it by the deadline.

Gift price target is $25. Sign up by 30 November 2020. Ship gifts to arrive by 20 December 2020.

item.title: National Nanny Recognition Week & interNational Nanny Training Day
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: We have recently updated the post on the current standing of the interNational Nanny Training Days of North Carolina. 2020 once again claimed as victims all training days except Chapel Hill, which has gone virtual and is still on schedule for September 12th. Want a free admission? Help NannyCast with producing their annual Cards Against […]
item.content:encoded:
We have recently updated the post on the current standing of the interNational Nanny Training Days of North Carolina. 2020 once again claimed as victims all training days except Chapel Hill, which has gone virtual and is still on schedule for September 12th.

Want a free admission?

Help NannyCast with producing their annual Cards Against Humanity nanny-themed add-on pack by submitting card ideas and you’ll be entered into a raffle for FREE ADMISSION to interNational Nanny Training Day 2020: Chapel Hill.

Free.

Don’t believe us? Hear it from the source:

Get it done by September 9, 2020, and you might win.

Here’s how to submit your card ideas: https://forms.gle/TFmcrbi2ZQjhKGkDA

So what does this have to do with National Nanny Recognition Week? Well, if you’ll look at our schedule of events on the NC PAN National Nanny Recognition Week page, you’ll see that every Saturday of NNRW, NannyCast provides the nanny-themed add-on pack to everyone for free as a NNRW treat. So you’ll be helping yourself learn and helping yourself play!

You’ll notice that our calendar looks a little bit different this year. That’s because we’ve had to swap in-person events for remote events. Hopefully those remote events will still prove enjoyable enough that we’ll all have fun attending!

item.title: Make Group Calls More Comfortable
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: This stay-home experience has a lot more of us on a lot more video chats. But there’s always that one person with the background noise that makes the video chat difficult to follow. Don’t be that person. And even better, don’t be that person FOR FREE! And here is A REFERRAL LINK for 1 month […]
item.content:encoded:
This stay-home experience has a lot more of us on a lot more video chats. But there’s always that one person with the background noise that makes the video chat difficult to follow. Don’t be that person. And even better, don’t be that person FOR FREE!

And here is A REFERRAL LINK for 1 month of Free Pro for being a supporting member! You get 1 free month and the NC PAN account gets 1 free month at no extra charge to anyone.

GET BONUS VIA REFERRAL LINK

If you don’t want the bonus or make it a general rule never to use affiliate or referral links, you can find the service which provides 120 minutes of background noise elimination per month on the free plan at https://krisp.ai/.

item.title: Nanny Karaoke
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Levenbook
item.description: Sunday, 3 May 2020 @ 3-6 pm CT / 4-7 pm ET. —— LEARN MORE Thanks to the existence of COVID-19, Ask the Nanny is putting together a monthly Sunday social. The past two months, the social has been karaoke. And who doesn’t like to sing? Or at least hear others sing beautifully? The cost […]
item.content:encoded:
Sunday, 3 May 2020 @ 3-6 pm CT / 4-7 pm ET. —— LEARN MORE

Thanks to the existence of COVID-19, Ask the Nanny is putting together a monthly Sunday social. The past two months, the social has been karaoke. And who doesn’t like to sing? Or at least hear others sing beautifully? The cost is free.

Bring your props, wigs, weaves, boas, hats, instruments and anything else that will transform you into “EVERY WOMAN”.

It’s time for some “I’m Every Woman” Karaoke. Sing your favorite female hits from the last three decades.

Event Description
CLICK HERE TO REGISTER

If you do not have Facebook, you can still register by sending an email to thenanny@atnanny.com.

Cannot attend this Sunday Social? Follow Ask the Nanny on Facebook to be aware of all future Sunday Socials, or simply keep an eye on our NC Nanny Calendar as all events NC Nannies can attend will be included.
